mn82:41.1: Not just the king, but others too,
mn82:41.2: reach death not rid of craving.
mn82:41.3: They leave the body still wanting,
mn82:41.4: for in this world sensual pleasures never satisfy.
mn82:42.1: Relatives lament, their hair let loose,
mn82:42.3: They take out the body wrapped in a shroud,
mn82:42.4: heap up a pyre, and burn it there.
mn82:43.1: It’s poked with stakes while being burnt,
mn82:43.2: in just a single cloth, all wealth gone.
mn82:43.4: can’t help you when you’re dying.
mn82:44.2: while beings fare on according to their deeds.
mn82:44.3: Riches don’t follow you when you die;
mn82:44.4: nor do children, wife, wealth, nor kingdom.
mn82:45.2: nor does wealth banish old age;
mn82:45.3: For the sages say this life is short,
mn82:46.1: The rich and the poor feel its touch;
mn82:46.2: the fool and the wise feel it too.
mn82:46.3: But the fool lies stricken by their own folly,
mn82:46.4: while the sage doesn’t tremble at the touch.
mn82:47.1: Therefore wisdom’s much better than wealth,
mn82:47.2: since by wisdom you reach consummation in this life.
mn82:47.3: But if because of delusion you don’t reach consummation,
mn82:47.4: you’ll do evil deeds in life after life.
mn82:48.1: One who enters a womb and the world beyond,
mn82:48.2: will transmigrate from one life to the next.
mn82:48.3: While someone of little wisdom, placing faith in them,
mn82:48.4: also enters a womb and the world beyond.
mn82:49.1: As a bandit caught in the door
mn82:49.2: is punished for his own bad deeds;
mn82:49.3: So after passing away, in the world beyond,
mn82:49.4: people are punished for their own bad deeds.
mn82:50.1: Sensual pleasures are diverse, sweet, delightful;
mn82:50.2: in so many ways they disturb the mind.
mn82:50.3: Seeing danger in the many kinds of sensual stimulation,
mn82:51.1: As fruit falls from a tree, so people fall,
mn82:51.2: young and old, when the body breaks up.
mn82:51.3: Seeing this, too, I went forth, O King;
mn82:51.4: The ascetic life is guaranteed to be better.”
